title: [GAMEPLAY] Maokai Sapling Range Bug/Exploit

embed.description: Watch xiaowayne's video: Maokai Range bug exploit.... rito pls fix - Plays.tv

body:
I was playing around in a CO-OP game and accidentally encountered this bug. 

Basically, if cast my E on Maokai (sapling) once out of range, and wait for Maokai to walk a little bit, then proceed to cast it a second time right before the champion reaches the original cast spot and starts its cast time, the cast location gets replaced.

This sounds kind of confusing but I have provided a link of my gameplay.

It is kind of hard to replicate, but I believe the timing has to be right before the original cast time starts. The resulting range is pretty much global and can be cast from base to enemy nexus.

Kind of new to League of legends forums but still thought I should attempt to report this bug. Sorry if i have violated any rules for this posting.

replies.body:
Hey! 

Thanks for the report! Maokai had been disabled to resolve this issue. We pushed a fix into the build, and the issue has been resolved, and Maokai is once again available to be played. :)

whoaaaa! there's actually people reading here!

I posted another bug 3 times during the last 4 months, there is a way I could know if you guys read it or should I keep working for you and keep posting it?

Last time I did this took me like 10 months, multiple posts, a couple ticket suports and a new account for NA forums until RiotForScience read it and fixed it on the Summoners Rift rework.

I'm really dissapointed. 


In case someone wants to do their job: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/xvAawLtH-gameplay-shaco-clone-ignores-player-input-after-killing-a-plant

Nice find. It looks like it went through since they disabled him for now.
